resources.string: Amhrán na bhFiann Soldiers are we, whose lives are pledged to Ireland, Some have come from a land beyond the wave, Sworn to be free, no more our ancient sireland, Shall shelter the despot or the slave. Tonight we man the "bearna baoil",[fn 4] In Erin\'s cause, come woe or weal, ’Mid cannon\'s roar and rifles\' peal, We\'ll chant a soldier\'s song.
